primary.context: Customer wants to dispose of their property
primary.detail: The agent attempted to transfer the caller for an out-of-scope request, but the caller was returned to the AI after a long queue wait.

steps: Agent attempted to identify the caller and their intent before transferring.
Caller specified they wanted to sell their ownership entirely.
Agent entered a clarification loop, repeatedly asking about renting instead of selling.
Agent initiated a transfer to the concierge department.
Caller waited in a queue for over 25 minutes before being returned to the AI agent.
AI agent informed the caller no representatives were available and offered help again.
Caller disconnected after expressing frustration that the AI could not help.

failure.detail: Agent entered a repetitive clarification loop about renting vs selling after the user had already clarified their intent.

clarifications.note: Agent asks to clarify rent vs sell
Agent asks about renting after user said sell

corrections.note: User clarifies they want to sell ownership entirely
User repeats they want to sell outright

loops.subject: selling vs renting
loops.note: Agent repeatedly asks about renting despite sell intent

actions.detail: Queue timeout returned caller to AI agent

insights.summary: The caller wanted to sell their timeshare ownership. The AI agent struggled to accept this intent, repeatedly asking if they wanted to rent instead, before eventually transferring the caller to a queue where they waited for 25 minutes only to be returned to the AI and eventually hang up.
insights.verbatim: Instead of ownership entirely... You just saw it out right.
insights.coaching: The agent should have immediately recognized 'sell ownership entirely' as out-of-scope and transferred without the repetitive and confusing clarification loop regarding the rental program.
